intro: Kibessia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kibessia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
